intro: Spermacoce matanzasia, commonly known as the Matanzas spiderling, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red berries. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
